intro: Ipsea malabarica, commonly known as the Malabar ipsea, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
